page.title: 19TWO CONTRASTING SCHOOLS 2
page.content: Gypsy women do ragging which is asking for old clothes, and selling from a basket. They have to be prepared to walk at least 10 miles though. In the caravans it is very clean. The walls are made from chrome and there are a lot of things which are cut glass. The Travellers also have stereos and videos. They call us "GOUJO". 11th May 1985. Today is the 21st anniversary of the Junior end of {Eye Church of England school}. (9.30) Great! It was time for our swimming lesson. We grabbed our swimming bags and lined up. On the way we stopped to let Mrs Nicol take a photo of us all. When we got to the pool we put our swimming costumes on and jumped into the water.We did front crawl and then back stroke.It was enjoyable.
